trans-unit.source: You can use Azure Active Directory to add users to your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure Active Directory to add users to your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Manage account users
trans-unit.target: Manage account users

trans-unit.source: Manage account users
trans-unit.target: Manage account users

trans-unit.source: You can use Azure Active Directory to add users to your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: You can use Azure Active Directory to add users to your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Each user is assigned a role that gives them a specific set of permissions to the account.
trans-unit.target: Each user is assigned a role that gives them a specific set of permissions to the account.

trans-unit.source: You can also assign a role to a group of users, or to an Azure AD application.
trans-unit.target: You can also assign a role to a group of users, or to an Azure AD application.

trans-unit.source: **Important** In order to add and manage account users, you must first associate your Dev Center account with your organization's Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: **Important** In order to add and manage account users, you must first associate your Dev Center account with your organization's Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: This requires you to sign in to Azure AD with a Global Admin account.
trans-unit.target: This requires you to sign in to Azure AD with a Global Admin account.

trans-unit.source: Once you establish this association, you won't be able to remove it without contacting support.
trans-unit.target: Once you establish this association, you won't be able to remove it without contacting support.

trans-unit.source: Associate your Dev Center account with your organization's Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Associate your Dev Center account with your organization's Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Windows Dev Center leverages Azure Active Directory for multi-user management and roles assignment.
trans-unit.target: Windows Dev Center leverages Azure Active Directory for multi-user management and roles assignment.

trans-unit.source: If your organization already uses Office 365 or other business services from Microsoft, you already have Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: If your organization already uses Office 365 or other business services from Microsoft, you already have Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you can [get it for free](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=703757).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you can [get it for free](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=703757).

trans-unit.source: Note that only one Dev Center account can be associated with an Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Note that only one Dev Center account can be associated with an Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, only one Azure Active Directory can be associated with a Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, only one Azure Active Directory can be associated with a Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: To set up the association:
trans-unit.target: To set up the association:

trans-unit.source: Go to your **Account settings** and click **Manage users**.
trans-unit.target: Go to your **Account settings** and click **Manage users**.

trans-unit.source: Click the button to associate your account with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Click the button to associate your account with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to your Azure AD account.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to your Azure AD account.

trans-unit.source: This account must have Global Admin permission in order to set up the association.
trans-unit.target: This account must have Global Admin permission in order to set up the association.

trans-unit.source: Review the organization and domain name for your Azure AD account.
trans-unit.target: Review the organization and domain name for your Azure AD account.

trans-unit.source: To complete the association, click **Confirm**.
trans-unit.target: To complete the association, click **Confirm**.

trans-unit.source: If the association is successful, you will then be ready to add and manage account users on the **Manage users** page of your account.
trans-unit.target: If the association is successful, you will then be ready to add and manage account users on the **Manage users** page of your account.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You can only add users to your Dev Center account if they are part of your organization’s Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You can only add users to your Dev Center account if they are part of your organization’s Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: You won’t be able to add users to your Dev Center account with their Microsoft accounts.
trans-unit.target: You won’t be able to add users to your Dev Center account with their Microsoft accounts.

trans-unit.source: Add and manage account users, groups, and Azure AD applications
trans-unit.target: Add and manage account users, groups, and Azure AD applications

trans-unit.source: Once you have established the association, you can add users, groups, and Azure AD applications to your account.
trans-unit.target: Once you have established the association, you can add users, groups, and Azure AD applications to your account.

trans-unit.source: You can also change roles, edit account details, or remove users.
trans-unit.target: You can also change roles, edit account details, or remove users.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If your organization uses [directory integration](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=724033) to sync the on-premises directory service with your Azure AD, you won't be able to create new users, groups, or Azure AD applications in Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If your organization uses [directory integration](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=724033) to sync the on-premises directory service with your Azure AD, you won't be able to create new users, groups, or Azure AD applications in Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: You (or another admin in your on-premises directory) will need to create them directly in the on-premises directory before you'll be able to see and add them in Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: You (or another admin in your on-premises directory) will need to create them directly in the on-premises directory before you'll be able to see and add them in Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: When managing users, keep the following in mind:
trans-unit.target: When managing users, keep the following in mind:

trans-unit.source: All Dev Center users must have an active account in your organization's Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: All Dev Center users must have an active account in your organization's Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Creating a **new** user or group in Dev Center will also add them to your organization's Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Creating a **new** user or group in Dev Center will also add them to your organization's Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Making changes to a user or group's name in Dev Center will make those changes in your organization's Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Making changes to a user or group's name in Dev Center will make those changes in your organization's Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Users (including groups and Azure AD applications) will be able to access the entire Dev Center account with the permissions associated with their assigned role.
trans-unit.target: Users (including groups and Azure AD applications) will be able to access the entire Dev Center account with the permissions associated with their assigned role.

trans-unit.source: You can't limit a user's access so that they can only work with specific apps and/or IAPs.
trans-unit.target: You can't limit a user's access so that they can only work with specific apps and/or IAPs.

trans-unit.source: You can allow a user, group, or Azure AD application to have access to more than one role's functionality by selecting multiple roles.
trans-unit.target: You can allow a user, group, or Azure AD application to have access to more than one role's functionality by selecting multiple roles.

trans-unit.source: A user with a certain role may also be part of a group that has a different role.
trans-unit.target: A user with a certain role may also be part of a group that has a different role.

trans-unit.source: In that case, the user will have access to the functionality associated with both roles.
trans-unit.target: In that case, the user will have access to the functionality associated with both roles.

trans-unit.source: Roles and permissions
trans-unit.target: Roles and permissions

trans-unit.source: Each user, group, or Azure AD application that you add to an account must be assigned at least one of the following roles.
trans-unit.target: Each user, group, or Azure AD application that you add to an account must be assigned at least one of the following roles.

trans-unit.source: Each role has a specific set of permissions in order to perform certain functions within the account.
trans-unit.target: Each role has a specific set of permissions in order to perform certain functions within the account.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The owner of the account is the person who first created it with a Microsoft account (rather than any users added through Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: **Note** The owner of the account is the person who first created it with a Microsoft account (rather than any users added through Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: This account owner is the only person with complete access to the account, including the ability to delete apps, create and edit all account users, and change all financial and account settings.
trans-unit.target: This account owner is the only person with complete access to the account, including the ability to delete apps, create and edit all account users, and change all financial and account settings.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft account that was used to create the account must be used when creating app packages in Microsoft Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft account that was used to create the account must be used when creating app packages in Microsoft Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Role
trans-unit.target: Role

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Manager
trans-unit.target: Manager

trans-unit.source: Has complete access to the account, except for changing tax and payout settings.
trans-unit.target: Has complete access to the account, except for changing tax and payout settings.

trans-unit.source: This includes managing users in Dev Center, but note that the ability to create and delete users is dependent on the account's permission in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: This includes managing users in Dev Center, but note that the ability to create and delete users is dependent on the account's permission in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: That is, if a user is assigned the Manager role, but does not have admin permissions in the organization's Azure AD, they will not be able to create new users or delete users from the directory (but they can change a user's Dev Center role).
trans-unit.target: That is, if a user is assigned the Manager role, but does not have admin permissions in the organization's Azure AD, they will not be able to create new users or delete users from the directory (but they can change a user's Dev Center role).

trans-unit.source: Developer
trans-unit.target: Developer

trans-unit.source: Can upload packages and submit apps and IAPs, and can view the [Usage report](usage-report.md) for telemetry details.
trans-unit.target: Can upload packages and submit apps and IAPs, and can view the [Usage report](usage-report.md) for telemetry details.

trans-unit.source: Can’t view financial info or account settings.
trans-unit.target: Can’t view financial info or account settings.

trans-unit.source: Business Contributor
trans-unit.target: Business Contributor

trans-unit.source: Can access financial info, and can set pricing details.
trans-unit.target: Can access financial info, and can set pricing details.

trans-unit.source: Can’t create or submit new apps and IAPs or change account settings.
trans-unit.target: Can’t create or submit new apps and IAPs or change account settings.

trans-unit.source: Finance Contributor
trans-unit.target: Finance Contributor

trans-unit.source: Can view [payout reports](payout-summary.md).
trans-unit.target: Can view [payout reports](payout-summary.md).

trans-unit.source: Can’t make any changes to apps, IAPs, or account settings.
trans-unit.target: Can’t make any changes to apps, IAPs, or account settings.

trans-unit.source: Marketer
trans-unit.target: Marketer

trans-unit.source: Can [respond to customer reviews](respond-to-customer-reviews.md) and view non-financial [analytic reports](analytics.md).
trans-unit.target: Can [respond to customer reviews](respond-to-customer-reviews.md) and view non-financial [analytic reports](analytics.md).

trans-unit.source: Can’t make any changes to apps, IAPs, or account settings.
trans-unit.target: Can’t make any changes to apps, IAPs, or account settings.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Users with the Manager or Developer role can submit apps through the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Users with the Manager or Developer role can submit apps through the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: However, when creating app packages in Visual Studio, the Microsoft account used to open the developer account must be used, rather than an Azure AD account.
trans-unit.target: However, when creating app packages in Visual Studio, the Microsoft account used to open the developer account must be used, rather than an Azure AD account.

trans-unit.source: Add and manage account users
trans-unit.target: Add and manage account users

trans-unit.source: To identify users that you want to add to your Dev Center account and assign them a role, click **Add users**.
trans-unit.target: To identify users that you want to add to your Dev Center account and assign them a role, click **Add users**.

trans-unit.source: You can add one or more users from your organization's directory to your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: You can add one or more users from your organization's directory to your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you add more than one user at the same time, you must assign the same role.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you add more than one user at the same time, you must assign the same role.

trans-unit.source: If you want to add users but assign them different roles, repeat the steps below for each role.
trans-unit.target: If you want to add users but assign them different roles, repeat the steps below for each role.

trans-unit.source: Add users from your organization's directory
trans-unit.target: Add users from your organization's directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add users**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add users**.

trans-unit.source: Select one or more users from the list that appears.
trans-unit.target: Select one or more users from the list that appears.

trans-unit.source: You can use the search box to search for specific users.
trans-unit.target: You can use the search box to search for specific users.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished selecting users, click **Add selected**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished selecting users, click **Add selected**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to this set of users.
trans-unit.target: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to this set of users.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: If you want to grant Dev Center access to a brand new user account, you can create one in the **Manage users** section.
trans-unit.target: If you want to grant Dev Center access to a brand new user account, you can create one in the **Manage users** section.

trans-unit.source: Note that this will create a new account in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Note that this will create a new account in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Create a new user account
trans-unit.target: Create a new user account

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add users**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add users**.

trans-unit.source: On the next page, click **New user**.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, click **New user**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the first name, last name, and username for the new user.
trans-unit.target: Enter the first name, last name, and username for the new user.

trans-unit.source: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to the new user.
trans-unit.target: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to the new user.

trans-unit.source: In the **Group membership** section, select any groups to which you want the new user to belong.
trans-unit.target: In the **Group membership** section, select any groups to which you want the new user to belong.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: On the confirmation page, you'll see login info for the new user, including a temporary password.
trans-unit.target: On the confirmation page, you'll see login info for the new user, including a temporary password.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to note this info and provide it to the new user, as you won't be able to access the temporary password after you leave this page.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to note this info and provide it to the new user, as you won't be able to access the temporary password after you leave this page.

trans-unit.source: You can make changes to user accounts that you've added to your Dev Center account in the **Manage users** section.
trans-unit.target: You can make changes to user accounts that you've added to your Dev Center account in the **Manage users** section.

trans-unit.source: Note that changes to the user's name or group membership will be reflected in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Note that changes to the user's name or group membership will be reflected in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Changes made to a user's role will only affect their Dev Center access.
trans-unit.target: Changes made to a user's role will only affect their Dev Center access.

trans-unit.source: Edit a user account
trans-unit.target: Edit a user account

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the user account that you want to edit.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the user account that you want to edit.

trans-unit.source: Make any of the following changes:
trans-unit.target: Make any of the following changes:

trans-unit.source: Edit the user's first name, last name, or username.
trans-unit.target: Edit the user's first name, last name, or username.

trans-unit.source: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.
trans-unit.target: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.

trans-unit.source: In the **Roles** section, select or deselect the role(s) that you want to add or remove for this user.
trans-unit.target: In the **Roles** section, select or deselect the role(s) that you want to add or remove for this user.

trans-unit.source: In the **Group membership** section, select or deselect the group(s) that you want the user to join or be removed from.
trans-unit.target: In the **Group membership** section, select or deselect the group(s) that you want the user to join or be removed from.

trans-unit.source: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.
trans-unit.target: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: If you need to change a password for a user account that you've added to your Dev Center account, you can do so in the **Manage users** section.
trans-unit.target: If you need to change a password for a user account that you've added to your Dev Center account, you can do so in the **Manage users** section.

trans-unit.source: Note that this will change the user's directory password, not just the password for their Dev Center access.
trans-unit.target: Note that this will change the user's directory password, not just the password for their Dev Center access.

trans-unit.source: Changing a user's directory password
trans-unit.target: Changing a user's directory password

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the user account that you want to edit.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the user account that you want to edit.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Reset password** button at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Reset password** button at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: A confirmation page will appear showing the login info for the user, including a temporary password.
trans-unit.target: A confirmation page will appear showing the login info for the user, including a temporary password.

trans-unit.source: **Important** Be sure to print or copy this info and provide it to the user, as you won't be able to access the temporary password after you leave this page.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Be sure to print or copy this info and provide it to the user, as you won't be able to access the temporary password after you leave this page.

trans-unit.source: Add and manage groups
trans-unit.target: Add and manage groups

trans-unit.source: When you add a group from your organization's directory to your Dev Center account, every user who is a member of that group will be able to access it, with the permissions associated with the group's assigned role.
trans-unit.target: When you add a group from your organization's directory to your Dev Center account, every user who is a member of that group will be able to access it, with the permissions associated with the group's assigned role.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that any changes made to groups (including their name or membership) will be reflected in your organization's directory.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that any changes made to groups (including their name or membership) will be reflected in your organization's directory.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you add more than one group at the same time, you must assign the same role.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you add more than one group at the same time, you must assign the same role.

trans-unit.source: If you want to add groups but assign them different roles, repeat the steps below for each role.
trans-unit.target: If you want to add groups but assign them different roles, repeat the steps below for each role.

trans-unit.source: Add groups from your organization's directory
trans-unit.target: Add groups from your organization's directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add groups**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add groups**.

trans-unit.source: Select one or more groups from the list that appears.
trans-unit.target: Select one or more groups from the list that appears.

trans-unit.source: You can use the search box to search for specific groups.
trans-unit.target: You can use the search box to search for specific groups.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished selecting groups, click **Add selected**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished selecting groups, click **Add selected**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to this set of groups.
trans-unit.target: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to this set of groups.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: If you want to grant Dev Center access to a brand new group, you can create a new group in the **Manage users** section.
trans-unit.target: If you want to grant Dev Center access to a brand new group, you can create a new group in the **Manage users** section.

trans-unit.source: Note that the new group will be created in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Note that the new group will be created in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Create a new group account
trans-unit.target: Create a new group account

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add groups**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add groups**.

trans-unit.source: On the next page, click **New group**.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, click **New group**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the display name for the new group.
trans-unit.target: Enter the display name for the new group.

trans-unit.source: Select one or more roles to assign to the new group.
trans-unit.target: Select one or more roles to assign to the new group.

trans-unit.source: All members of the group will be able to access your Dev Center account with the permissions associated with that role
trans-unit.target: All members of the group will be able to access your Dev Center account with the permissions associated with that role

trans-unit.source: Select one or more users from the list that appears.
trans-unit.target: Select one or more users from the list that appears.

trans-unit.source: You can use the search box to search for specific users.
trans-unit.target: You can use the search box to search for specific users.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished selecting users, click **Add selected**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished selecting users, click **Add selected**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You can make changes to group accounts that you've added to your Dev Center account in the **Manage users** section.
trans-unit.target: You can make changes to group accounts that you've added to your Dev Center account in the **Manage users** section.

trans-unit.source: Note that changes to the group's name and membership will be reflected in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Note that changes to the group's name and membership will be reflected in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Changes made to a group's role will only affect that group's Dev Center access.
trans-unit.target: Changes made to a group's role will only affect that group's Dev Center access.

trans-unit.source: Edit a group account
trans-unit.target: Edit a group account

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the group account that you want to edit.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the group account that you want to edit.

trans-unit.source: To change group info, make any desired changes to the group's name.
trans-unit.target: To change group info, make any desired changes to the group's name.

trans-unit.source: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.
trans-unit.target: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.

trans-unit.source: To change the group role, select or deselect the role(s) that you want to apply to the group.
trans-unit.target: To change the group role, select or deselect the role(s) that you want to apply to the group.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Add and manage Azure AD applications
trans-unit.target: Add and manage Azure AD applications

trans-unit.source: You can allow applications or services that are part of your organization's Azure AD to access your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: You can allow applications or services that are part of your organization's Azure AD to access your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Note that when you add more than one Azure AD application at the same time, you must assign the same role.
trans-unit.target: Note that when you add more than one Azure AD application at the same time, you must assign the same role.

trans-unit.source: If you want to add groups but assign them different roles, repeat the steps below for each role.
trans-unit.target: If you want to add groups but assign them different roles, repeat the steps below for each role.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure AD applications from your organization's directory
trans-unit.target: Add Azure AD applications from your organization's directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add Azure AD applications**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add Azure AD applications**.

trans-unit.source: Select one or more Azure AD applications from the list that appears.
trans-unit.target: Select one or more Azure AD applications from the list that appears.

trans-unit.source: You can use the search box to search for specific Azure AD applications.
trans-unit.target: You can use the search box to search for specific Azure AD applications.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished selecting Azure AD applications, click **Add selected**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished selecting Azure AD applications, click **Add selected**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to this set of Azure AD applications.
trans-unit.target: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to this set of Azure AD applications.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: If you want to grant Dev Center access to a brand new Azure AD application account, you can create one in the **Manage users** section.
trans-unit.target: If you want to grant Dev Center access to a brand new Azure AD application account, you can create one in the **Manage users** section.

trans-unit.source: Note that this will create a new account in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Note that this will create a new account in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure AD application
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure AD application

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add Azure AD applications**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click **Add Azure AD applications**.

trans-unit.source: On the next page, click **New Azure AD application**.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, click **New Azure AD application**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **Reply URL** for the new Azure AD application.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **Reply URL** for the new Azure AD application.

trans-unit.source: This is the URL where users can sign in and use your Azure AD application (sometimes also known as the App URL or Sign-On URL).
trans-unit.target: This is the URL where users can sign in and use your Azure AD application (sometimes also known as the App URL or Sign-On URL).

trans-unit.source: The **Reply URL** can't be longer than 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: The **Reply URL** can't be longer than 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **App ID URI** for the new Azure AD application.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **App ID URI** for the new Azure AD application.

trans-unit.source: This is a logical identifier for the Azure AD application that is presented when it sends a single sign-on request to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: This is a logical identifier for the Azure AD application that is presented when it sends a single sign-on request to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Note that the **App ID URI** must be unique for each Azure AD application in your directory, and it can't be longer than 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: Note that the **App ID URI** must be unique for each Azure AD application in your directory, and it can't be longer than 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to the new Azure AD application
trans-unit.target: In the **Roles** section, select one or more roles to assign to the new Azure AD application

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You can make changes to Azure AD applications that you've added to your Dev Center account in the **Manage users** section.
trans-unit.target: You can make changes to Azure AD applications that you've added to your Dev Center account in the **Manage users** section.

trans-unit.source: Note that changes to the Reply URL and App ID URI will be reflected in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Note that changes to the Reply URL and App ID URI will be reflected in your organization's directory, not just in your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Role changes will only affect the Azure AD application's permissions within Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: Role changes will only affect the Azure AD application's permissions within Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: Edit an Azure AD application
trans-unit.target: Edit an Azure AD application

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the Azure AD application account that you want to edit.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the Azure AD application account that you want to edit.

trans-unit.source: To change the **Reply URL** or **App ID URI**, enter the new values here.
trans-unit.target: To change the **Reply URL** or **App ID URI**, enter the new values here.

trans-unit.source: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.
trans-unit.target: Remember, these changes will be made in your organization's directory.

trans-unit.source: To change the Azure AD application's role, select or deselect the role(s) that you want to apply.
trans-unit.target: To change the Azure AD application's role, select or deselect the role(s) that you want to apply.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: If your Azure AD application reads and writes data in Microsoft Azure AD, it will need a key.
trans-unit.target: If your Azure AD application reads and writes data in Microsoft Azure AD, it will need a key.

trans-unit.source: You can create keys for an Azure AD application by editing its info in Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: You can create keys for an Azure AD application by editing its info in Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: You can also remove keys that are no longer needed.
trans-unit.target: You can also remove keys that are no longer needed.

trans-unit.source: Manage keys for an Azure AD application
trans-unit.target: Manage keys for an Azure AD application

trans-unit.source: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the Azure AD application.
trans-unit.target: From the **Manage users** page, click the name of the Azure AD application.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** When you click the name of the Azure AD application, you'll see all of the active keys for the Azure AD application, including the date on which the key was created and when it will expire.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** When you click the name of the Azure AD application, you'll see all of the active keys for the Azure AD application, including the date on which the key was created and when it will expire.

trans-unit.source: To remove a key that is no longer needed, click **Remove**.
trans-unit.target: To remove a key that is no longer needed, click **Remove**.

trans-unit.source: To add a new key, click **Add new key**.
trans-unit.target: To add a new key, click **Add new key**.

trans-unit.source: You will see a screen showing the **Client ID** and **Key** values.
trans-unit.target: You will see a screen showing the **Client ID** and **Key** values.

trans-unit.source: **Important** Be sure to print or copy this info, as you won't be able to access it again after you leave this page.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Be sure to print or copy this info, as you won't be able to access it again after you leave this page.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create more keys, click **Add another key**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create more keys, click **Add another key**.

trans-unit.source: Removing users, groups, and Azure AD applications
trans-unit.target: Removing users, groups, and Azure AD applications

trans-unit.source: To remove a user, group, or Azure AD application from your Dev Center account, click the **Remove** link that appears by their name on the **Manage users** page.
trans-unit.target: To remove a user, group, or Azure AD application from your Dev Center account, click the **Remove** link that appears by their name on the **Manage users** page.

trans-unit.source: After confirming that you want to remove it, that user, group, or Azure AD application will no longer be able to access to your Dev Center account (unless you add it again later).
trans-unit.target: After confirming that you want to remove it, that user, group, or Azure AD application will no longer be able to access to your Dev Center account (unless you add it again later).

trans-unit.source: **Note** Removing a user, group, or Azure AD application means that it will no longer have access to your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Removing a user, group, or Azure AD application means that it will no longer have access to your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: It does not delete the user, group, or Azure AD application from your organization's directory.
trans-unit.target: It does not delete the user, group, or Azure AD application from your organization's directory.
